summary: TAKATA RECALL    MONTHS AGO I WAS INFORMED PASSENGER AIRBAG INFLATORS MAY DEGRADE AFTER PROLONGED EXPOSURE TO HIGH HUMIDITY AND FLUCTUATING HIGH TEMPERATURES, AND METAL FRAGMENTS COULD PASS THROUGH THE AIRBAG CUSHION MATERIAL, STRIKING THE VEHICLE OCCUPANTS, AND RESULT IN SERIOUS INJURY OR DEATH.    WHILE I APPRECIATE THAT TOYOTA HAS INFORMED ME THEY ARE WORKING ON A REMEDY, I AM UNABLE TO SAFELY TRANSPORT ANYONE, BE IT MY GIRLFRIEND, FRIENDS, OR FAMILY, AS A RESULT OF THE POOR MANUFACTURING AND PLANNING OF THIS COMPANY. I AM FRUSTRATED, AS HIGH HUMIDITY AND FLUCTUATING HIGH TEMPERATURES ARE NOT NEW TO THE PLANET, OR TO CAR MANUFACTURING, AND I NEED A REPLACEMENT ASAP. I LIVE IN FL AND HAVE NO INTEREST IN TRYING TO RECTIFY A FATALITY AS A RESULT OF AN UNTIMELY CORRECTION OF TOYOTA'S OWN ERROR.     TOYOTA'S WEBSITE SAYS TO CHECK NHTSA'S WEBSITE IF I FEEL THE REMEDY IS NOT IN A REASONABLE TIMEFRAME. I FEEL THAT SEVERAL MONTHS IS REASONABLE, AND I'M READY FOR A CALL OR LETTER TO COME IN AND GET THIS TAKEN CARE OF. I PURCHASED THIS VEHICLE FROM THIS MANUFACTURER WITH SAFETY AND RELIABILITY AS MY TOP CONCERN, AND I NEED YOU TO PLEASE HOLD THEM ACCOUNTABLE FOR THEIR PROMISES.     "REASONABLE TIMEFRAME" IS NOT DEFINED, NOT EVEN BY A RANGE.
